pli-tv-pvr2.8:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.1: (5) When a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, how many kinds of offences does she commit?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.2: She commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.3: when she consents to him taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.4: when she consents to him taking hold of her above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:1.5: when she consents to him taking hold of something connected to her body, she commits an offence of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.1: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.2: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.3: Through how many of the six kinds of origination of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.4: To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.5: Through how many of the seven ways of settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.6: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.7: they may be failure in morality;  they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.8: They are found in three classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.9: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.11: from body and mind, not from speech.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.12: They are legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.13: They are settled in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:2.14: … and by a covering over (as) with grass….
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.1: Partaking of curds, having had them asked for, how many offences does she fall into?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.2: Partaking of curds, having had them asked for, she falls into two offences:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.3: as she accepts saying, “I will partake of,” the offence is one of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.4: for every mouthful the offence is one to be Confessed.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:3.5: Partaking of curds … she falls into these two offences.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.1: Of the four fallings away how many fallings away do these offences appertain to …
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.5: by which deciding are they stopped?
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.6: Of the four fallings away these offences appertain to one falling away;
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.7: the falling away from good behaviour.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.8: Of the seven classes of offence they are comprised in two classes of offence:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.9: it may be in the class of offence that is to be Confessed; it may be in the class of offence of wrong-doing.
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.10: Of the six origins of offences they originate by four origins:
pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.11: it may be that they originate by body, not by speech, not by mind; it may be that they originate by body and by speech, not by mind; it may be that they originate by body and by mind, not by speech; it may be that they originate by body and by speech and by mind.

pli-tv-pvr2.8:4.15: … and by a covering over (as) with grass.
